text: This is not what it is. The cool part about zero DTEs, especially from my approach, is that they do allow you to tap into a less correlated return source. The intraday moves still matter, but you're really trying to take a sampling of vol and you're trading that more specifically. So you might have the rest of your portfolio scattered across all these different expressions. The market can be going down. Those positions might not be doing well, but then this can perform just fine in that kind of context. So it gives you another return source. Again, really important to pay attention to the total fees that you're paying because it gets expensive. That liquidity can dry up so poorly at the end of the day. So if you're trying to run stops, you can get mutilated by that. You have to be super careful. And then as I mentioned before, making sure for me, using European style options so that I'm not worrying about taking something into expiration and coming up with inventory that I don't want.
